titles.title: A bill to repeal the provision of title 46, United States Code, requiring a license for employment in the business of salvaging on the coast of Florida.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.

calendar.text: Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

committee.name: Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation

action.text: Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation. Reported by Senator Inouye without amendment. With written report No. 110-340.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 750.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Mr. Cummings moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 2482.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 10/8/2008--Public Law. Repeals a provision requiring both a vessel and its master to have a license to engage in the business of salvaging on the coast of Florida.
